other_tests.findings: Diffuse alveolar hemorrhage. The lavage fluid was red, with a hematocrit of less than 3.0% and a white-cell count of 463 per cubic millimeter (72% neutrophils, 2% band forms, 3% lymphocytes, 6% monocytes, 1% eosinophils, 16% macrophages). Hemosiderin-laden macrophages were present. No evidence of respiratory viruses, fungi, bacteria, or acid-fast bacilli.
other_tests.changes_over_time: During the next week, the patient remained dependent on the ventilator and pressors; pulmonary suctioning produced thick, bloody sputum.

other_tests.findings: Trilineage hematopoiesis with no abnormal lymphocyte populations or cytogenetic abnormalities.

Diffuse alveolar hemorrhage, irregular tan areas of consolidation containing abundant fungal hyphae consistent with aspergillus, and malignant features consistent with a high-grade epithelioid angiosarcoma.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The irregular, tan area of consolidation in the right lung showed abundant fungal hyphae.
